title: Valentine prompt page for Tasbiha (single-screen, evasive No, image reveal)

requirements.summary: Build a single-screen romantic Valentine prompt addressed to Tasbiha with exactly two choices: Yes and No.
acceptanceCriteria: The main prompt clearly asks Tasbiha to be the user’s Valentine.
Only two choice buttons are presented: “Yes” and “No”.
All user-facing text is in English and includes the name “Tasbiha” as spelled by the user.

file_operations.description: Create the single-screen Valentine prompt UI addressed to “Tasbiha”, rendering exactly two actions (“Yes” and “No”) and keeping all user-facing copy in English. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Button/Card) to provide consistent UI styling and accessible button behavior; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the new single-screen App as the only rendered experience (ensuring no additional pages/navigation are introduced) and keep the entry lightweight for this interaction.

requirements.summary: Make the No button playfully evade pointer and touch interactions while staying within the viewport; Yes remains stable.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop, hovering the cursor over the “No” button causes it to reposition away from the cursor before it can be clicked.
On mobile/touch, attempting to tap the “No” button causes it to move away such that it is effectively not tappable.
The “Yes” button remains stable and clickable/tappable at all times.
The “No” button stays within the visible viewport (does not move off-screen).

file_operations.description: Implement reusable logic to reposition the “No” button in response to pointer hover/move and touch/pointer-down attempts, clamping the computed position so the button stays fully within the visible viewport.

Integrate the evasive “No” behavior (hover and touch-safe) using the new hook, ensuring the “Yes” button remains fixed/stable and that the “No” button never moves off-screen. Use shadcn-ui Button for consistent hit-area sizing; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: On Yes, transition to a celebratory confirmation state and display the provided image as-is (no content edits).
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking/tapping “Yes” changes the page state to a success/celebration view.
The provided image is displayed in that success view.
The app uses the exact image file provided by the user without modifying the image content (no cropping, filters, recoloring, or overlays on the image itself).

file_operations.description: Add the exact user-provided image file to the app as a static asset (place the original file here with no edits or transformations).

Implement the success/celebration view shown after “Yes” is clicked/tapped and render the static image asset (frontend/public/assets/valentine-image.jpg) without applying cropping, filters, recoloring, or overlays on the image itself.

requirements.summary: Apply a cohesive romantic pink/white theme with a responsive, touch-friendly layout that works well on iPad/phones in Chrome.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary visual palette is pink and white (backgrounds, buttons, accents).
Layout is responsive and fits common phone and tablet viewports without horizontal scrolling.
Buttons are large enough for touch (no tiny tap targets), and text remains readable on mobile.
All interactivity works in Chrome on mobile/tablet (no hover-only critical flows besides the intended “No” avoidance, which must also handle touch).

file_operations.description: Add global styling entrypoint used by the app to establish a pink/white romantic theme (backgrounds, typography defaults) and mobile-friendly base styles (e.g., ensuring no horizontal scrolling).

Apply responsive layout and touch-friendly sizing (large buttons, readable text) using the existing Tailwind setup and shadcn-ui component styling where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure the experience is fully frontend-only with no backend calls, persistence, or server-side dependencies.
acceptanceCriteria: The Valentine interaction works without calling backend methods.
No data persistence, accounts, or server-side dependencies are required to use the page.

file_operations.description: Ensure the Valentine interaction is implemented entirely with local React state and does not import or call any backend capabilities (no backend method usage).
Remove/avoid any unnecessary backend-related providers or initialization for this page so the app runs as a lightweight single-page interaction without server-side dependencies.
